byline.contributor: Alan Blinder contributed reporting from Ferguson, and Timothy Williams from New York.
byline.original: By JOHN ELIGON and MITCH SMITH

abstract: St Louis County officials declare state of emergency in Ferguson, Mo, after plainclothes police officers shoot and critically wound Tyrone Harris Jr, 18-year-old black man who they said was shooting at them; law enforcement officers from surrounding towns arrive to help maintain calm on streets amid peaceful protests on first anniversary of fatal police shooting of Michael Brown.
lead_paragraph: Charges were filed against an 18-year-old who was shot by the police on the anniversary of the killing of Michael Brown, and late Monday police arrested more protesters after isolated scuffles.

headline.main: Emergency Declared in Ferguson After Shooting
headline.print_headline: An Emergency Is Declared After a Ferguson Shooting

snippet: Charges were filed against an 18-year-old who was shot by the police on the anniversary of the killing of Michael Brown, and late Monday police arrested more protesters after isolated scuffles.
